meanings.definition: The quality of persisting or continuing steadfastly.
meanings.sent1: Her persistency in studying every day paid off when she aced the exam.
meanings.sent2: His persistency in practicing the piano led to a beautiful recital performance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's persistency in trying to reach the bird feeder was both amusing and impressive.
meanings.sent4: The persistency of the dripping faucet echoed through the empty house, a constant reminder of the need for repair.
meanings.sent5: The persistency of the toddler's questions about the stars showed a deep curiosity and determination.

meanings.definition: The act of persisting or persevering.
meanings.sent1: Despite facing many obstacles, her persistency in pursuing her dream never wavered.
meanings.sent2: The persistency of the hikers paid off when they finally reached the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The persistency of the cat in trying to catch the laser pointer dot provided endless entertainment for the family.
meanings.sent4: The persistency of the waves crashing against the shore was a reminder of nature's relentless power.
meanings.sent5: The persistency of the ant colony in rebuilding their anthill after a rainstorm was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The state of being persistent or tenacious.
meanings.sent1: His persistency in negotiations helped him secure a better deal for his company.
meanings.sent2: The persistency of the detective in solving the case impressed everyone on the force.
meanings.sent3: The persistency of the rain falling all day made the streets flood, creating a waterlogged mess.
meanings.sent4: The persistency of the sun beating down on the desert created a shimmering mirage in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The persistency of the weeds growing through the cracks in the pavement showed nature's unstoppable force.
